alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 30 at 8:37PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of north central Wyoming, including the following county, Sheridan. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 832 PM MDT, Emergency Management reported heavy rain causing small stream flooding of property along North Piney Creek and Piney Creek including the area around Story. Between 3 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - North Piney Creek and Piney Creek is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Flooding is also possible along South Piney Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in continued minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Story and mainly rural areas of Southern Sheridan County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places.
